0.title: Complexity of Discrete Energy Minimization Problems

property.Purpose: However , is it possible to approximate this problem with a reasonable ratio bound on the solution quality in polynomial time ? We show in this paper that the answer is no.
property.Mechanism: Moreover , we collect and review the computational complexity of several subclass problems and arrange them on a complexity scale consisting of three major complexity classes - PO , APX , and exp-APX , corresponding to problems that are solvable , approximable , and inapproximable in polynomial time . Problems in the first two complexity classes can serve as alternative tractable formulations to the inapproximable ones.
